1) State and explain De-Broglie’s hypothesis of matter waves.State any 2 properties of matter waves.

2) Obtain the equation to De-Broglie wavelength of matter wave in terms of energy by analogy with radiation. 

3) Derive an equation for De-Broglie wavelength in terms of electrons. 

4) Starting from h/mv , obtain λ=h/(√2mE), where E is K.E of a particle. 

5) State and explain properties of matter waves. 

6) Does the matter waves are electromagnetic? Explain. 

7) Show that: Phase velocity of matter wave is C2/v, where ‘C’ is speed of light and ‘v’ is velocity of particle. 

8) Define phase velocity and group velocity. Hence obtain the relation between them for De-Broglie wave. 

9) Show that group velocity is equal to particle velocity. 

10) State and explain Heisenberg’s uncertainty principle. 

11) Illustrate the Uncertainty principle with electron diffraction experiment at a single slit. 

12) Prove Heisenberg’s Uncertainty principle for pair of variables energy and time.
